projects.title: Halifax Canoe and Kayak
projects.description: A website for booking canoe and kayak adventures, showcasing skills in full-stack development and the basics of cloud computing using AWS Cloud. This project was undertaken as part of the Digital Nova Scotia - Skills for Hire program
details: Created the website as a project for booking adventures in canoeing and kayaking from the available trips.
Designed a responsive UI using HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, JavaScript, and jQuery based on wireframe designs.
Developed the backend and implemented server-side form validation using PHP.
Managed version control using Git and GitHub for all three phases of the project.
Integrated Docker containers using docker-compose and deployed the image on DockerHub.
Deployed the website on AWS as Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS), utilizing EC2, configuring a LAMP Stack, and utilizing RDS for the MySQL relational database.

projects.title: Nish-Foody
projects.description: A website for food ordering and selling, demonstrating skills as a full-stack developer and documentarian. This final project, part of the software design course, spanned over 3 months and was completed by a team of 5 members
details: Developed a fully-functional website for food ordering and selling specifically for the people of Antigonish.
Worked as a full-stack developer in a 5-member team throughout the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) to create the website as the final year project.
Conducted surveys among individuals from diverse backgrounds to perform requirement analysis, and took the lead in documentation.
Designed the menu page using HTML5, CSS3, and Bootstrap for the user interface, and implemented the cart functionality for order management using JavaScript/jQuery.
Implemented the Django framework to create a REST API that seamlessly connected with a PostgreSQL database.
Followed the Agile methodology, utilizing tools such as JIRA and Confluence pages for documentation purposes.

projects.title: Portfolio Website
projects.description: My personal website serves as a platform to showcase my skills to the world. Highlights my proficiency as a front-end developer, utilizing ReactJS and ChakraUI
details: Utilized the Vite tool to create the app, enabling faster build times for the ReactJS application.
Demonstrated expertise in utilizing component libraries like ChakraUI to create reusable and modular components.
Effectively utilized React hooks such as useState, useEffect, useRef, and useContext when necessary.
Containerized the application using Docker and published the image on DockerHub.
Created a database on Google Cloud Platform's Firebase, a Backend-as-a-Service solution, and utilized Firebase Storage for handling files.
Developed mini-projects to experiment with various features such as data fetching, forms, carousel creation, learning different hooks, implementing dark mode, and more.
Hosted the application on the Netlify platform, which continuously integrates updates from the master branch of the GitHub repository
Utilized chatGPT for prompt engineering purposes, leveraging its capabilities to debug code and learn the implementation of certain features.
Integrated emailJS services to enable sending an email by submitting the form.

projects.title: Hotel Management System
projects.description: Developed over four phases using the waterfall methodology, the project focused on creating a relational database for efficient room booking and reservation management
details: Developed the relational database as part of a 4-member team for the Hotel Management System.
Actively participated in creating the Entity-Relationship Diagram (ERD), designing the database, and normalizing it.
Performed CRUD operations while ensuring the integrity constraints were maintained across the 4 out of 15 tables using SQL.
Created Python scripts to automate the generation and loading of a large amount of data into the database.
Prepared meaningful Views and executed useful queries by applying joins on the tables.
Deployed the relational database on the university's Oracle Server, which was hosted by the professor.

projects.title: Crime Analysis
projects.description: A comprehensive study on the factors influencing crime in the USA across three decades: the 1980s, 1990s, and 2000s. The project's motivation stems from the recent increase in crime rates, including incidents such as mass shootings
details: Conducted data collection by analyzing USA data obtained from Kaggle and the FBI Crime Data Explorer.
Performed data wrangling by splitting and merging datasets, employing Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) techniques to convert raw data into valuable information.
Utilized functions from the ggplot2 library to generate high-quality and meaningful visualizations.
Conducted exploratory data analysis to identify correlations between crime rates and two factors: unemployment and education.
Utilized modeling techniques to understand how different types of crime have evolved over the decades in the USA.
Summarized the evolution of unemployment rates and crime rates over the three decades.
Prepared residual plots to demonstrate the distribution of errors and assess the robustness of our models.
Generated an R-markdown report that presents our work, starting from data collection to our findings on the factors affecting crime rates.

projects.title: Sentiment Analysis
projects.description: Investigated a dataset containing 3000+ tweets to determine their sentiment as positive, negative, or neutral. The project showcased expertise in preprocessing English-language sentences, specifically tweets, to prepare them for sentiment analysis
details: Implemented various methods, including regular expressions, to remove hyperlinks, punctuations, whitespaces, hashtags, mentions, RT, emojis, and other unwanted elements from the tweets.
Utilized NLTK to remove stopwords and applied lemmatization to convert the cleaned tweets into meaningful words for analysis purposes.
Employed the TextBlob library to determine the polarity of the cleaned tweets and evaluated the sentiment of each tweet based on the results.
Visualized the distribution of positive, negative, and neutral sentiments among over 3000 tweets using a pie chart.
Utilized scikit-learn to determine the top 10 popular words for each sentiment by eliminating common words during the process.
Presented the popular words for each sentiment using a word cloud visualization.

projects.title: Food-Order Analysis
projects.description: This project involved analyzing New York restaurants, serving as a first-time experience utilizing the Google Colab platform for analysis purposes. The project focused on data transformation and visualization to explore various scenarios
details: Checked the number of restaurants for each cuisine type and visualized the results using appropriate plots.
Visualized the top 10 most popular restaurants for each cuisine type and highlighted the top 3 restaurants.
Investigated the proportion of reviews for a specific restaurant (Shake Shack) and demonstrated the findings.
Determined the correlation between ratings and food preparation time using the r-value (Pearson correlation coefficient).
Created various plots, such as pie charts, bar charts, and box plots, using libraries like Matplotlib, Seaborn, and Plotly.

projects.title: Multi-Class Image Classification
projects.description: This project focused on deep learning using a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) applied to the Intel Image Classification dataset obtained from Kaggle. By leveraging CNN, the project showcased skills in achieving approximately 80% accuracy for the multi-class (6 classes) classification on the test data.
details: Preprocessed the image data acquired from Kaggle using scikit-learn, numpy, and pandas according to the requirements.
Utilized Keras to load the data for the CNN, based on the LeNet architecture with minor improvements, to start the training.
Achieved approximately 64% accuracy on the training data and about 31% accuracy on the testing data with 1 epoch using the initial model.
Improved the model by adding feature maps at the dense layer before the fully-connected layer, resulting in around 84% accuracy on the training data after 5 epochs.

Experimented with converting the images to grayscale to further improve the model, but encountered reshaping errors that were resolved by adding a rescaling layer (ideally, data augmentation would have been the solution).
Further improved the model by dropping some layers to prevent overfitting, increasing the training accuracy to about 94% and reaching a testing accuracy of 76% after 10 epochs.

Trained the best model, up to that point, for 100 epochs, adding a few Conv2D layers and applying batch normalization, resulting in approximately 99% accuracy on the training data and 80% accuracy on the testing data.

Concluded from experiments with different numbers of epochs that increasing epochs beyond a certain point does not necessarily improve accuracy, but performing cross-validation does. Determined that the ideal number of epochs for the model is 30.
Plotted the results for different numbers of epochs, showcasing the performance of the model used for each particular training/testing.
Created a table to compare and display the performance of all the models, ranging from the basic LeNet to the best model achieved.
Summarized the project and provided thoughts on techniques that can be used to further improve the model in the future.

projects.title: Deep Learning on MNIST Dataset
projects.description: The Machine Learning Competition for the MNIST dataset, where the task was to achieve the lowest error rate on the test data without access to any labels.
details: This assignment was a cross-discipline competition with over 80 participants from BSc, MACS and PBDAI programs at StFX, focusing on the MNIST dataset.
Achieved the 2nd rank in the competition, despite having no prior Data Science experience and learning the prerequisite course simultaneously.
Enhanced the LeNet model by adding additional layers to improve its accuracy for the specific task.
Incorporated Conv2D layers with 32 feature maps, 5x5 kernel, unit stride, and relu activation with bias.
Implemented normalization layers to stabilize images and facilitate faster convergence.
Utilized pooling layers to extract key features from specific regions, enhancing the learning process.
Addressed overfitting concerns by dropping layers, allowing the model to learn patterns instead of memorizing data.
Employed a dense layer for a fully-connected neural network and a softmax layer with 10 units for the 10-class classification.
Trained and tested the model using Stratified-Shuffle-Split technique on the training data, improving accuracy over 30 epochs.
Generated error data from internal training/testing as well as predictions on the test data for submission in the competition.

projects.title: Image Reconstruction
projects.description: The evolutionary computation project utilizes a genetic algorithm, which operates on the principle of survival of the fittest. The project serves as a demonstration of how genetic algorithms can be applied to generate high-quality solutions for optimization and research problems.
details: Demonstrated image reconstruction using the Genetic Algorithm, based on Darwin's theory of natural selection.
Implemented the Genetic Algorithm using PyGAD and other supporting libraries to execute the algorithm.
Created the initial population and evaluated the fitness of each chromosome in the population.
Selected the fittest chromosome for the next generation and performed recombination (crossover) to inherit genes from both parents.
Applied mutation to introduce diversity and prevent getting stuck in local maxima/minima of the search space.
Iterated the process by adding the new generation to the population until the desired criteria were achieved.
Explored different crossover and selection strategies to optimize the quality of solutions within a reasonable time.
Documented the process and findings in a research paper format, using LaTeX for the project report.

projects.title: Particle Swarm Optimization
projects.description: An evolutionary algorithm technique was used to solve optimization problems by emulating the social behavior of birds searching for food. This unique algorithm does not require the problem to be differential, distinguishing it from other classical optimization techniques.
details: The algorithm aims to iteratively improve candidate solutions based on a fitness function.
Each particle within the swarm possesses a position, velocity vector, and fitness value, with their best position and fitness values recorded.
Communication between particles allows them to access the global best position and value of the swarm.

The algorithm's parameters include the number of dimensions, lower and upper bounds, while hyperparameters consist of the number of particles, maximum iterations, inertia component, particle cognition (local), and swarm social influence (global).
Optimization was performed on various functions such as Sphere, Beale, Booth, Levi, etc., with plots generated to illustrate the cost versus iteration and particle movements.
The findings and work were documented in the form of a research paper using LaTeX.

projects.title: Minesweeper
projects.description: I developed my own version of the classic Minesweeper game using the PyGame library. This project served as a demonstration of my object-oriented programming skills, showcasing my ability to design and implement a game with interactive features and gameplay mechanics.
details: Demonstrated the use of the Pygame library by reading and understanding its documentation to create a functional Minesweeper game.
Implemented modular and reusable code following the DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself) principle and adhering to the Python style guide.
Created a project video and uploaded it to my YouTube channel, providing an explanation of all the game's features and a basic overview of the program.

projects.title: Snake
projects.description: Developed my own rendition of the iconic Snake game, drawing inspiration from the classic version found on Nokia phones. This project marked my introduction to the field of Computer Science.
details: Initiated my programming journey by switching careers from Mechanical Engineering to Computer Science.
Completed the first mini-project for the Harvard CS50 course using Scratch, a graphical programming language.
Showcased proficiency in Scratch language by implementing increasingly complex functionalities.
Gained practical experience in programming concepts such as variables, conditionals, loops, and control structures.

projects.title: 8 Puzzle Solver AI
projects.description: Successfully implemented the A* algorithm to solve the 8 Puzzle. Demonstrated my understanding of Data Structures and Algorithm practically.
details: Executed the Object-Oriented Programming approach to create a grid and facilitate movement for the classic 8 Puzzle game.
Implemented the A* algorithm to efficiently find the minimum number of moves required to solve the game starting from a given initial configuration.
Demonstrated adherence to the DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself) principle and code modularity, allowing for easy extension of the code to accommodate N-puzzle games.
Modularized the game to support N-Puzzle variations by adjusting the size of the grid to N.

certificates.title: Career Essentials in Software Development
certificates.about: I completed this 3 coruse certification series to understand the core principles about Software Development

certificateDetails.certName: Introduction to Career Skills in Software Development
certificateDetails.learnings: I gained knowledge about various branches within software development and received a comprehensive introduction to the field.
Learned about fundamentals of programming in the different languages like python, javascript, ruby, etc.
Learned how to work with collections, use external code, find and fix bugs, and more.
I learned various skills needed for a career in software development, the core concepts and structure of programming languages and how to apply them in real world.

certificates.title: Google IT Professional Certificate
certificates.about: Completed as a part of Junior IT Analyst program of NPower Canada

certificateDetails.learnings: I learned how to assemble a computer, gained knowledge about the basics of the internet, obtained an overview of operating systems and applications, learned problem-solving methodologies, and developed the necessary soft skills required in the field of Information Technology.

certificateDetails.certName: The Bits and Bytes of Computer Networking
certificateDetails.learnings: In this course, I learned the basics of computer networking, including the five-layer and OSI model, standard protocols, network troubleshooting techniques, as well as the fundamentals of DNS and DHCP server functionality.

certificateDetails.certName: Operating Systems and You: Becoming a Power User
certificateDetails.learnings: I gained knowledge about both Windows and Linux operating systems, including their respective file systems. I learned how to install, configure, and remove software, perform disk partitioning, set up users, groups, and permissions, manage background processes, and troubleshoot common issues related to operating systems.

certificateDetails.certName: System Administration and IT Infrastructure Services
certificateDetails.learnings: In this course, I acquired knowledge on selecting the most suitable hardware and services for organizations. I also learned how to manage infrastructure servers, including topics such as Active Directory and OpenLDAP. Additionally, I gained understanding of data backup and recovery processes, and how to utilize system administration knowledge to plan and enhance IT environments.

certificateDetails.certName: IT Security: Defense against the digital dark arts
certificateDetails.learnings: I gained a foundational understanding of Cloud Computing. I learned about various aspects such as IaaS, Paas, SaaS, cloud storage, and security principles including IPS/IDS and firewall concepts.

During this professional program, I gained a comprehensive understanding of IT support and explored various domains within the field, including Computer Networking, Operating Systems, System Administration, Computer Security, and more.
I was awarded the professional certification badge by Credly in recognition of successfully completing the program.

I enrolled in NPower Canada's Junior IT Analyst program with the aim of gaining practical training in the IT field, specifically focusing on computer networking and security, to complement my existing experience as a Technician. In addition to acquiring technical skills, the program provided valuable soft skills training and insightful guidance on job search strategies within the Canadian IT market.

certificates.title: Web Development
certificates.about: I earned this certificate as a participant in the Skills for Hire - Web Development program offered by Digital Nova Scotia.

certificateDetails.learnings: I learned fundamental concepts of web development, including back-end development using technologies like PHP and NodeJS, as well as front-end development utilizing HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript (ES6), and jQuery. Additionally, I gained exposure to Docker, CI/CD basics, and the fundamentals of AWS.

certificates.title: Programming Competitions
certificates.about: I participated in the ICPC Programming competition as a member of Team X-abytes-1, representing StFX University. Our team was mentored by Professor Dr. Milton King, who provided guidance and support throughout the competition.

certificateDetails.learnings: During the ICPC Programming competition, we were required to apply our knowledge of data structures and algorithms. This experience taught me valuable lessons in time management and working under pressure, as we had to brainstorm ideas and collaborate effectively as a team.

Throughout the competition, we gained valuable experience in teamwork and problem-solving. We learned how to effectively collaborate by sharing ideas and iterating on solutions to overcome challenging problems. This allowed us to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of our solutions.

certificates.title: Harvard Certificates
certificates.about: I actively participated in Harvard's CS50 courses and other related events to enhance my understanding of Computer Science.

certificateDetails.learnings: I gained a comprehensive understanding of the Computer Science field, covering topics such as data structures, algorithms, memory management, and fundamental concepts, and developed proficiency in multiple programming languages including Scratch, C, Python, HTML, and JavaScript, through hands-on assignments and projects such as image recovery, spell-checker, and the game of fifteen.

I earned this certificate for participating in the 2019 Puzzle Day event as part of a diverse international team consisting of members from Belgium, Turkey, Ukraine, and the Netherlands. We collaborated and coordinated our efforts through the Discord platform as colleagues in the CS50 course, successfully solving 9 out of the 12 puzzles to receive this recognition.

I earned this certificate for the second year in a row by participating in the online Puzzle Day event. This year, I decided to challenge myself and participated as a one-member team. I was rewarded the certificate for successfully solving 6 out of 8 puzzles.

I enrolled in the Data Science course to gain a foundational understanding of the field, as I was captivated by the concepts of Machine Learning introduced in the MIT 6002x course. This course marked my first step in specializing in the field of Data Science.

certificates.title: MIT Certificates
certificates.about: After successfully completing Harvard's CS50 course and establishing a strong foundation in Computer Science, my peers highly recommended this course to me when I was seeking recommendations for Python courses.

certificateDetails.certName: Introduction to Computer Science and Programming Using Python
certificateDetails.learnings: During this course, I delved deep into core computer science concepts, including the application of mathematics in areas such as big-O analysis. In addition to acquiring technical skills, I also gained valuable insights into time management and stress management due to strict deadlines.

certificateDetails.certName: Introduction to Computational Thinking and Data Science
certificateDetails.learnings: This course presented me with new and exciting challenges, sparking my interest in pursuing a career in Data Science and Machine Learning. I gained knowledge in topics such as graph data structures and algorithms, stochastic programming and statistical thinking, Monte Carlo simulation, various plotting libraries, and an introduction to Machine Learning with K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN) algorithm.
I received this certificate for successfully completing the X Series Program, which included the completion of both the MIT 6001x and 6002x courses.

certificates.title: Microsoft Certificates
certificates.about: I enrolled in these courses to acquire a solid understanding of the fundamentals of the Java programming language, laying the groundwork for my journey into software development.

certificateDetails.learnings: I gained knowledge of fundamental programming concepts, such as data types, variables, logic, loops, control flow, functions, and other key terminologies in the Java programming language.

In this course, I acquired knowledge and skills in working with arrays, understanding classes and objects, implementing inheritance, utilizing polymorphism, working with abstract classes, and implementing interfaces.

During this course, I gained proficiency in various searching and sorting algorithms, including bubble sort, selection sort, merge sort, linear search, and binary search. Additionally, I learned about important data structures such as linked lists, stacks, and queues.

I was awarded this certificate for successfully completing the Java programming series offered by Microsoft. Throughout the program, I gained proficiency in programming using the Java language and acquired knowledge of relevant terminologies associated with the language.

experiences.title: Customer Service Associate
responsibilities: Increased customer engagement by effectively handling queries and utilizing resources to curb wait times during peak hours, contributing to an increase in revenue generation
Delivered excellent customer service by identifying individual problems and providing solutions over emails, resulting in a significant improvement in customer satisfaction
Created quality custom macros for various customer inquiries using the Zendesk environment for the ticketing system, resulting in high productivity and a reduction in service delivery speed

experiences.title: Shipping Associate
responsibilities: Created a strong rapport with customers by executing sound judgment, patience, and active listening skills to resolve customers' shipping requirements resulting in an increased customer satisfaction rate

Demonstrated willingness to learn various skills in the copy center, work with copy center associates in the peak hours, and assist in other departments when needed justified 'Learn, Work, and Grow together' at Staples

Provided excellent services to the customer in Shipping and Copy Center by accommodating customers with their various needs and helped other departments on demand, demonstraning the teamwork, resulting in minimizing the losses of the company during the downtime

experiences.title: Cashier
responsibilities: Contributed to increasing revenue of the branch by maintaining a low waiting time during the peak hours at the drive-through by providing excellent customer service and operating the POS with a high accuracy

Contributed to the team helping in maintaining food and beverages quality by analyzing the patterns of demand of customers at different hours for the various products, which helped in diminishing the food-waste

Proved the work ethic by working during the various shifts as requested that benefited the crew members by having their time off as needed, which helped in maintaining the overall productivity of the team

experiences.title: Clerk

Increased customer engagement in the Bulk department by rearranging the products to make them easier to find following customer needs, helping to increase sales during the festival season

experiences.title: Department Assistant
responsibilities: Applied active listening to identify client needs and the book search and selection process, resulting in high client satisfaction and gaining repeat business
Transformed the department by applying Dewey Decimal Classification (DDC) to rectify mistakes in sorting books, resulting in around 500+ books being categorized correctly in the library system
Organized newspapers and magazines by the date and time daily, resulting in increased reliability of the archival system of the library

experiences.title: Technician
responsibilities: Boosted company reputation by providing excellent technical support to customers on time as a part of the maintenance and service department for both the hardware and software team

Modernized the department for the OS installation and Software installation process by introducing new technologies and incorporating remote solutions like TeamViewer to help the customer at remote locations
Demonstrated excellent inventory management skills by tracking stock and analyzing supply and demand trends, resulting in consistent availability of products and helping increase sales

experiences.title: Freelancing Tutor
responsibilities: Provided tuition services to the university students for 'Engineering Drawing/Graphics' subject by executing the skills I learned from my previous job as lecturer; helping them understand the material thoroughly and clear the University exams
Taught Mathematics and Aptitude topics for the competitive exams; resulted in our student gaining very good score in both topics in those exams

experiences.title: Adhoc Lecturer
responsibilities: Increased student success rate by 10% in recent years in the subjects of 'Engineering Drawing/Graphics' and 'Elements of Mechanical Engineering by applying a practical approach to curriculum delivery

Contributed to the development of course material by accumulating challenging examples from various reference books, creating new problems and preparing solutions, and delivering feedback on the assignments and exams on time, resulting in a high-quality study guide for students available free of cost

volunteer.title: Community Teaching Assistant

Curated and maintained the Facebook-group for the term as a moderator with Dr. Ana Bell (MIT Professor) creating a plagiarism free support group on the facebook platform for the online learners

extracurriculars.name: International Collegiate Programming Contest
extracurriculars.details: I was honored to represent StFX for the 3rd time for programming competition during my 2-year span. This was my first in-person experience of any programming competition. I was member of team X-abyes1 along with Dalon and Vijay.

extracurriculars.name: Atlantic Canada Programming Competition
extracurriculars.details: The StFX University were hosting this event online for this year. We were the only team representing our university this time. Despite our heavy course load of 6 courses in our program with some advanced courses like Machine Learning, and Theory of Computing, I was honored to participate for this event with my team members Dalon and Vijay to represent our University. We were ranked 6 out of 12 participating teams.

extracurriculars.name: Atlantic Canada Programming Competition
extracurriculars.details: I partficiated as a member of team Green representing St. Francis Xavier University. We particiapted online and connected with team via ms-team because couldn't travel due to Covid19 and we were studying online. We were ranked 4 out of 20 particiapting teams for this event.
